result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Justine L. Brendum appeared with Attorney Jillian Jean Scheidegger.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Drew Lehman appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:   DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 10:00 am. Bond continued w/ same conditions (see previous bond entry). ec

10:08 AM Defendant Justine L. Brendum not in court.  Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:  No appearance by defendant.  Court authorizes a bench warrant for defendant's arrest with a $5,000 cash bond.

Defendant appears late.
11:07 AM Defendant Justine L. Brendum appeared late, in court.  Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Court vacates the warrant previously issued and reinstates bond. Court provides SPD application and advocate counsel paperwork to the Defendant. Court finds good cause to continue to toll time and schedules matter for an attorney status.  Status conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
